Context:
Last updated: September, 2020

The text provides information about Video Counselling services offered by George Brown College Counselling & Student Well-being Services. The counselling services occur through a secure video platform called Zoom. The data is hosted in Canadian servers to comply with Canadian Data Protection regulations including PIPEDA and PHIPA.

1. Consent: By submitting an online intake form, students consent to engaging in Video Counselling services. They are asked to read and agree to statements outlining the rights and conditions related to these services.

2. Rights and Conditions: Students have the right to withhold or withdraw consent at any time. The George Brown College Counselling & Student Well-being Services Privacy Policy applies to all aspects of Video Counselling services. To receive Video Counselling services, students must be physically located in Ontario at the time of the appointment. There are risks associated with Video Counselling services, including potential technical failures or unauthorized access to personal information. Students may be referred for other forms of intervention if their counsellor believes it is necessary.

3. Privacy Policy: The George Brown College Counselling & Student Well-being Services Privacy Policy applies to all aspects of Video Counselling services.

4. Location Restriction: To receive Video Counselling services, students must be physically located in Ontario at the time of the appointment.
